meaningMnemonic: 過ぎる is <vocabulary>to pass</vocabulary>. When you pass what is needed, what are you left with? Just this word: <vocabulary>too much</vocabulary>. This can also mean <vocabulary>after</vocabulary>, as in "after 5pm", and <vocabulary>past</vocabulary>, as in "past sixty".
readingMnemonic: The reading comes from 過ぎる. Know that and you know <vocabulary>too much</vocabulary>. Dial it down to get 過ぎ.
